metadata.subject: Loved or loathed, globalisation is here to stay

relationships.description: Author writing opinion piece for newspaper
Author writing opinion piece for newspaper
Author writing opinion piece for newspaper

analysis.purpose: To provide opinion and analysis on globalization and Chinese politics
analysis.significance: Offers insights into China's perspective on globalization and internal political dynamics during Xi Jinping's leadership

notable_quotes: "Globalisation, in the form of the spread of trade, money, people and information, is inevitable, essentially because of expanding demographics and technology."
"There is now no ambiguity: China is under the firm leadership of the party's Central Committee, with Xi as its core, and alignment with Xi's 'four confidences' doctrine... is non-negotiable."
"It is political ethics that stops a US cabinet secretary running against a president seeking re-election."

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion found in this opinion article

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is an opinion article about globalization and Chinese politics

details: Article published in South China Morning Post
References to foreign media coverage of China's anti-corruption drive

public_knowledge.context: This is a published opinion article in a major newspaper, making all content publicly available. The article discusses well-known political figures and global economic trends that were publicly debated topics in 2017.

analysis.summary: This South China Morning Post opinion section contains three articles: one analyzing globalization's inevitability and China's role in it, another discussing Xi Jinping's strengthened leadership position after the 'two sessions,' and a third examining political ethics in Hong Kong's chief executive election involving John Tsang.
